meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adjective 'dicky': showing a lack of skill or ability
meanings.sent1: He was the dickiest player on the team, always missing the ball.
meanings.sent2: Out of all the students, she was the dickiest at solving math problems.
meanings.sent3: The dickiest chef in the kitchen burned the toast every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts at painting were the dickiest brushstrokes I had ever seen.
meanings.sent5: The dickiest driver on the road caused a traffic jam with his slow speed.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adjective 'dicky': showing a lack of skill or ability
meanings.sent1: She was the dickiest artist in the class, struggling to draw a simple circle.
meanings.sent2: Of all the singers, he was the dickiest, always off-key.
meanings.sent3: The dickiest magician in the show made the rabbit disappear but couldn't bring it back.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were the dickiest at the party, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent5: The dickiest student in the group project forgot to include the main points in the presentation.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adverb 'dicky': in a poor or unsatisfactory manner
meanings.sent1: She sang dickiest during the performance, forgetting the lyrics.
meanings.sent2: He danced dickiest at the party, stepping on everyone's toes.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out dickiest after she forgot to add sugar to the mix.
meanings.sent4: The movie ended dickiest, leaving the audience confused about the plot.
meanings.sent5: The team played dickiest in the final match, losing by a large margin.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adverb 'dicky': in a poor or unsatisfactory manner
meanings.sent1: She sang dickiest of all during the concert, hitting all the wrong notes.
meanings.sent2: He performed dickiest at the talent show, forgetting his lines halfway through.
meanings.sent3: The dish was cooked dickiest, tasting bland and overcooked.
meanings.sent4: The plan was executed dickiest, resulting in chaos and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The speech ended dickiest, with the speaker stumbling over words and losing track of the topic.
